This header cell spans on the last two column (c2/c3).

This column spans on all three columns (c1/c2/c3). Let' add some text to test wraping: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cras a rutrum mauris. table.title: A bit of all cell features together
table.desc: This combined horizontal spanning, vertical spanning, row separators, column separator and vertical alignments rules. Each cell describes its behavior and expectations. It has an empty row at the end to test the empty row behavior.

row.entry: Column 1 with me text to see the alignment of the other header cells

This row has rowsep set to 0.

section.title: Elements test

table.title: Footnote offset test

row.entry: Col A
Col B

entry.fn: First footnote of the offset table
Second footnote of the offset table.

section.p: Just adding a couple of footnotes here, to make sure the offset for the table is working, since the counter for footnote is global to the topic, but the text-table plugin has access only to the table context. Footnote 1 in paragraphFootnote 2 in paragraph

table.title: element tests
table.desc: This is a test of many elements within a table, including a table within a table within an horizontal span. The first column should be half the width of others.

row.entry: Element name
Simple use
More complex
Paragraph

entry.p: I am a very simple paragraph, with still a bit of content to test wrapping as always,.
This is a paragraph, and it has some content to see if it wraps fine. It will be followed by another paragraph to see how they behave together.

Here is another paragraph, to make this more interesting, this will content a unordered list following the next semi-colon:
Item 1: item 1 is a long item, to see how the wrapping behave, see if we have a nice identification below the prefix.
Item 2: short item to see
Item 3
